name: search_tweets
description: Search for tweets on X/Twitter and extract the results (up to 10 tweets).

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query (supports X search operators like 'from:user', 'min_faves:100', etc.)

steps.code: const tweets = []; const articles = document.querySelectorAll('article[data-testid="tweet"]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(articles.length, 10); i++) { const el = articles[i]; const userNameEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid="User-Name"]'); const tweetTextEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid="tweetText"]'); const timeEl = el.querySelector('time'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="/status/"]'); const likeEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid$="like"] span, [data-testid$="unlike"] span'); const retweetEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid$="retweet"] span, [data-testid$="unretweet"] span'); const replyEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid="reply"] span'); tweets.push({ author: userNameEl ? userNameEl.textContent.trim() : 'Unknown', text: tweetTextEl ? tweetTextEl.textContent.trim() : '', time: timeEl ? timeEl.getAttribute('datetime') : '', url: linkEl ? 'https://x.com' + linkEl.getAttribute('href') : '', likes: likeEl ? likeEl.textContent.trim() : '0', retweets: retweetEl ? retweetEl.textContent.trim() : '0', replies: replyEl ? replyEl.textContent.trim() : '0' }); } return { tweet_count: tweets.length, tweets: tweets }
steps.name: search_results
steps.label: Extract search results
